channel.title: Papers with Code: Latest (unofficial)
channel.description: As a disclaimer, this is an unofficial feed and has no affiliation with Papers with Code.

item.title: GNNFlow: A Distributed Framework for Continuous Temporal GNN Learning on Dynamic Graphs
item.description: We introduce GNNFlow, a distributed framework that enables efficient continuous temporal graph representation learning on dynamic graphs on multi-GPU machines.

item.title: Language-conditioned Detection Transformer
item.description: We use this detector to pseudo-label images with image-level labels.

item.title: eMotions: A Large-Scale Dataset for Emotion Recognition in Short Videos
item.description: The prevailing use of SVs to spread emotions leads to the necessity of emotion recognition in SVs.

item.title: When StyleGAN Meets Stable Diffusion: a $\mathscr{W}_+$ Adapter for Personalized Image Generation
item.description: Text-to-image diffusion models have remarkably excelled in producing diverse, high-quality, and photo-realistic images.

item.title: Cross-Scope Spatial-Spectral Information Aggregation for Hyperspectral Image Super-Resolution
item.description: The prevailing transformer-based methods have not adequately captured the long-range dependencies in both spectral and spatial dimensions.

item.title: Taiwan LLM: Bridging the Linguistic Divide with a Culturally Aligned Language Model
item.description: Leveraging a comprehensive pretraining corpus and instruction-finetuning datasets, we have developed a model that not only understands the complexities of Traditional Chinese but also embodies the cultural context of Taiwan.

item.title: Towards Real-World Focus Stacking with Deep Learning
item.description: Focus stacking is widely used in micro, macro, and landscape photography to reconstruct all-in-focus images from multiple frames obtained with focus bracketing, that is, with shallow depth of field and different focus planes.

item.title: U-Net v2: Rethinking the Skip Connections of U-Net for Medical Image Segmentation
item.description: We evaluate our method on several public medical image segmentation datasets for skin lesion segmentation and polyp segmentation, and the experimental results demonstrate the segmentation accuracy of our new method over state-of-the-art methods, while preserving memory and computational efficiency.

item.title: SigFormer: Sparse Signal-Guided Transformer for Multi-Modal Human Action Segmentation
item.description: Nowadays, the majority of approaches concentrate on the fusion of dense signals (i. e., RGB, optical flow, and depth maps).

item.title: SyncTalk: The Devil is in the Synchronization for Talking Head Synthesis
item.description: A lifelike talking head requires synchronized coordination of subject identity, lip movements, facial expressions, and head poses.

item.title: Group-wise Sparse and Explainable Adversarial Attacks
item.description: However, crafting such attacks poses an optimization challenge, as it involves computing norms for groups of pixels within a non-convex objective.

item.title: TimeBench: A Comprehensive Evaluation of Temporal Reasoning Abilities in Large Language Models
item.description: Understanding time is a pivotal aspect of human cognition, crucial in the broader framework of grasping the intricacies of the world.

item.title: GNNFlow: A Distributed Framework for Continuous Temporal GNN Learning on Dynamic Graphs
item.description: We introduce GNNFlow, a distributed framework that enables efficient continuous temporal graph representation learning on dynamic graphs on multi-GPU machines.

item.title: Biomedical knowledge graph-enhanced prompt generation for large language models
item.description: KG-RAG consistently enhanced the performance of LLMs across various prompt types, including one-hop and two-hop prompts, drug repurposing queries, biomedical true/false questions, and multiple-choice questions (MCQ).

item.title: OPERA: Alleviating Hallucination in Multi-Modal Large Language Models via Over-Trust Penalty and Retrospection-Allocation
item.description: Based on the observation, OPERA introduces a penalty term on the model logits during the beam-search decoding to mitigate the over-trust issue, along with a rollback strategy that retrospects the presence of summary tokens in the previously generated tokens, and re-allocate the token selection if necessary.

item.title: Focus on Query: Adversarial Mining Transformer for Few-Shot Segmentation
item.description: In this paper, we rethink the importance of support information and propose a new query-centric FSS model Adversarial Mining Transformer (AMFormer), which achieves accurate query image segmentation with only rough support guidance or even weak support labels.

item.title: The Devil is in the Data: Learning Fair Graph Neural Networks via Partial Knowledge Distillation
item.description: Experiments on several benchmark datasets demonstrate that FairGKD, which does not require access to demographic information, significantly improves the fairness of GNNs by a large margin while maintaining their utility.

item.title: Addressing Membership Inference Attack in Federated Learning with Model Compression
item.description: In this paper, we show that the effectiveness of these attacks on the clients negatively correlates with the size of the client datasets and model complexity.

item.title: Pose Anything: A Graph-Based Approach for Category-Agnostic Pose Estimation
item.description: This approach not only enables object pose generation based on arbitrary keypoint definitions but also significantly reduces the associated costs, paving the way for versatile and adaptable pose estimation applications.

item.title: Towards Higher Ranks via Adversarial Weight Pruning
item.description: To this end, we propose a Rank-based PruninG (RPG) method to maintain the ranks of sparse weights in an adversarial manner.

item.title: VITATECS: A Diagnostic Dataset for Temporal Concept Understanding of Video-Language Models
item.description: The ability to perceive how objects change over time is a crucial ingredient in human intelligence.

item.title: Unveiling the Implicit Toxicity in Large Language Models
item.description: While recent studies primarily focus on probing toxic outputs that can be easily detected with existing toxicity classifiers, we show that LLMs can generate diverse implicit toxic outputs that are exceptionally difficult to detect via simply zero-shot prompting.

item.title: The devil is in the fine-grained details: Evaluating open-vocabulary object detectors for fine-grained understanding
item.description: Recent advancements in large vision-language models enabled visual object detection in open-vocabulary scenarios, where object classes are defined in free-text formats during inference.

item.title: Continual Learning for Image Segmentation with Dynamic Query
item.description: Image segmentation based on continual learning exhibits a critical drop of performance, mainly due to catastrophic forgetting and background shift, as they are required to incorporate new classes continually.

item.title: Efficient Computation of Sparse and Robust Maximum Association Estimators
item.description: This paper investigates how such procedures can be used for robust sparse association estimators.

item.title: Smooth Video Synthesis with Noise Constraints on Diffusion Models for One-shot Video Tuning
item.description: By applying the loss to existing one-shot video tuning methods, we significantly improve the overall consistency and smoothness of the generated videos.

item.title: Cam4DOcc: Benchmark for Camera-Only 4D Occupancy Forecasting in Autonomous Driving Applications
item.description: Furthermore, the standardized evaluation protocol for preset multiple tasks is also provided to compare the performance of all the proposed baselines on present and future occupancy estimation with respect to objects of interest in autonomous driving scenarios.

item.title: Improving Self-supervised Molecular Representation Learning using Persistent Homology
item.description: Self-supervised learning (SSL) has great potential for molecular representation learning given the complexity of molecular graphs, the large amounts of unlabelled data available, the considerable cost of obtaining labels experimentally, and the hence often only small training datasets.

item.title: Multiple Toddler Tracking in Indoor Videos
item.description: Multiple toddler tracking (MTT) involves identifying and differentiating toddlers in video footage.

item.title: Driving into the Future: Multiview Visual Forecasting and Planning with World Model for Autonomous Driving
item.description: In autonomous driving, predicting future events in advance and evaluating the foreseeable risks empowers autonomous vehicles to better plan their actions, enhancing safety and efficiency on the road.

item.title: Evaluating Optimal Reference Translations
item.description: The overall translation quality reached by current machine translation (MT) systems for high-resourced language pairs is remarkably good.

item.title: On the Robustness of Decision-Focused Learning
item.description: Decision-Focused Learning (DFL) is an emerging learning paradigm that tackles the task of training a machine learning (ML) model to predict missing parameters of an incomplete optimization problem, where the missing parameters are predicted.

item.title: MedGen: A Python Natural Language Processing Toolkit for Medical Text Processing
item.description: This study introduces MedGen, a comprehensive natural language processing (NLP) toolkit designed for medical text processing.

item.title: Panoptic Video Scene Graph Generation
item.description: PVSG relates to the existing video scene graph generation (VidSGG) problem, which focuses on temporal interactions between humans and objects grounded with bounding boxes in videos.

item.title: Sluggish and Chemically-Biased Interstitial Diffusion in Concentrated Solid Solution Alloys: Mechanisms and Methods
item.description: Interstitial diffusion is a pivotal process that governs the phase stability and irradiation response of materials in non-equilibrium conditions.

item.title: Debiasing Multimodal Models via Causal Information Minimization
item.description: In this paper, we study bias arising from confounders in a causal graph for multimodal data and examine a novel approach that leverages causally-motivated information minimization to learn the confounder representations.

item.title: The Sky's the Limit: Re-lightable Outdoor Scenes via a Sky-pixel Constrained Illumination Prior and Outside-In Visibility
item.description: We also introduce a novel `outside-in' method for computing differentiable sky visibility based on a neural directional distance function.

item.title: Text2Tree: Aligning Text Representation to the Label Tree Hierarchy for Imbalanced Medical Classification
item.description: Deep learning approaches exhibit promising performances on various text tasks.

item.title: Centre Stage: Centricity-based Audio-Visual Temporal Action Detection
item.description: Previous one-stage action detection approaches have modelled temporal dependencies using only the visual modality.

item.title: Scalable Label Distribution Learning for Multi-Label Classification
item.description: Most existing MLC methods are based on the assumption that the correlation of two labels in each label pair is symmetric, which is violated in many real-world scenarios.

item.title: Brain-ID: Learning Robust Feature Representations for Brain Imaging
item.description: Recent learning-based approaches have made astonishing advances in calibrated medical imaging like computerized tomography, yet they struggle to generalize in uncalibrated modalities -- notoriously magnetic resonance imaging (MRI), where performance is highly sensitive to the differences in MR contrast, resolution, and orientation between the training and testing data.

item.title: Gaussian Processes for Monitoring Air-Quality in Kampala
item.description: Monitoring air pollution is of vital importance to the overall health of the population.

item.title: Enhancing Item-level Bundle Representation for Bundle Recommendation
item.description: In this paper, we propose a novel approach EBRec, short of Enhanced Bundle Recommendation, which incorporates two enhanced modules to explore inherent item-level bundle representations.

item.title: Graph Prompt Learning: A Comprehensive Survey and Beyond
item.description: This paper presents a pioneering survey on the emerging domain of graph prompts in AGI, addressing key challenges and opportunities in harnessing graph data for AGI applications.

item.title: MVBench: A Comprehensive Multi-modal Video Understanding Benchmark
item.description: With the rapid development of Multi-modal Large Language Models (MLLMs), a number of diagnostic benchmarks have recently emerged to evaluate the comprehension capabilities of these models.

item.title: Filter-Pruning of Lightweight Face Detectors Using a Geometric Median Criterion
item.description: Face detectors are becoming a crucial component of many applications, including surveillance, that often have to run on edge devices with limited processing power and memory.

item.title: DreamPropeller: Supercharge Text-to-3D Generation with Parallel Sampling
item.description: Recent methods such as Score Distillation Sampling (SDS) and Variational Score Distillation (VSD) using 2D diffusion models for text-to-3D generation have demonstrated impressive generation quality.

item.title: Typhoon Intensity Prediction with Vision Transformer
item.description: Predicting typhoon intensity accurately across space and time is crucial for issuing timely disaster warnings and facilitating emergency response.

item.title: CDEval: A Benchmark for Measuring the Cultural Dimensions of Large Language Models
item.description: This benchmark serves as a valuable resource for cultural studies in LLMs, paving the way for more culturally aware and sensitive models.

item.title: Opening the Black Box: Towards inherently interpretable energy data imputation models using building physics insight
item.description: While no significant improvement is observed in terms of reconstruction error with the proposed PI-DAE, its enhanced robustness to varying rates of missing data and the valuable insights derived from the physics-based coefficients create opportunities for wider applications within building systems and the built environment.
